ygData.subject: Re: Warriors vs Wizards
ygData.msgSnippet: Thats what I said.  The warriors can do two things better than any other class:  be a sponge, and die.  A ranger, paladin, and shadowknight can dish out just
ygData.messageBody:
Thats what I said. The warriors can do two things better than any other
class: be a sponge, and die. A ranger, paladin, and shadowknight can dish
out just as much damage, at higher levels.

> ----------
> From: Doc Lotus[SMTP:doclotus@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Friday, June 11, 1999 3:42 PM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Warriors vs Wizards
>
> From: Doc Lotus <doclotus@...>
>
> A sponge only absorbs damage. You can dish it out. No, you can't hit
> for 1100 in one shot but there's a point to that. Yes, you should be
> able to absorb more punishment than any other class, and you can. And
> yes, you can deal out a fair amount of damage, arguably the best of the
> melee classes. (Though yes that gap narrows at higher levels)
>
> Actually, I'm going to leave this thread alone from here on out. I see
> this thread in every friggin mail list related to class. The wizards
> think they are getting ripped, warriors too, enchanters, mages and
> bards...well bards may have a point. Everyone complains about their
> class and how another class is better.
>
> The point of these lists, if I'm not mistaken is to exchange strategies
> and means of development, NOT whine about your desires for the class.
> That is not to say that such discussion shouldn't happen. I just don't
> think it should be in this forum. I get tired of reading notes from
> each of the class lists that I subscribe to and 1/2 of the content
> contains complaints about the class and how everyone needs to petition
> verant. (The cleric list seems to be the exception, they seem quite
> happy with their class. Uh oh, that must mean they are overbalanced!
> <sg>)
>
> <dismounts the soapbox>
>
> --- "Jones, Brian" <brian.jones@...> wrote:
> > From: "Jones, Brian" <brian.jones@...>
> >
> > Wait until you get your warrior past the newbie
> > stages (somewhere around
> > level 20). At level 15, I can already see a
> > difference, even in a group,
> > that lets me know that I am one thing only: a
> > sponge.
> >
> >
> > Angarth, Sponge of the 15th Tier
> > "Periissem ni periisem"
> >
>
